title: Nelson Kibinge
text:
I am a senior scientist trained in computational biology, currently working for Orion Pharma in Finland, where I contribute to the discovery and development of novel therapeutics in oncology medicine addressing critical unmet needs for cancer patients worldwide. In this role, I lead the development and deployment of computational methods that drive the identification of novel drug targets, while also building target confidence and patient stratification criteria across pre-clinical and clinical programmes.
Previously, as a Senior Research Associate at the MRC Integrative Epidemiology Unit, University of Bristol, I applied statistical genomics methods such as Mendelian Randomization to discover and prioritise drug targets for neurological disorders, leveraging large-scale GWAS and proteomic datasets.
I also worked with malaria and viral epidemiology research groups at the KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Programme, where I contributed to the development of bioinformatics and AI-driven approaches across genomics, transcriptomics, and proteomics — deepening our understanding of development of human host immunology against malaria parasites.
In parallel, I hold an Adjunct Faculty position at Pwani University, Kenya.
My current research interest lies at the intersection of single-cell and spatial technologies, artificial intelligence, and oncology drug discovery; fields I continue to pursue with rigour and curiosity.

title: Nelson Kibinge
text: The landscape of paediatric infectious disease exposure in a rural sub-Saharan Africa setting in Kilifi, Kenya: longitudinal serological analysis over two decades and priorities for future vaccine development. Deirdre F Foley, Timothy K Chege, Joyce Kabagenyi, Karen McCarthy, Elijah T Gicheru, Nelson Kibinge, Angela W Maina, Jacqueline M Waeni, Ralf Clemens, Sue-Ann Costa Clemens, James Tuju, Charles J Sande. link

title: Nelson Kibinge
text:
Orion Pharma
Feb 2020 - Present, Turku, Finland
Orion Pharma is the largest Pharmaceautical company in Finland.
Responsibility:

Design, develop and implement data-science tools for research and development projects
Support research project with data-related questions especially utilizing high-throughput omics datasets
Apply cutting-edge computational and statistical tools for novel drug targets prioritization and biomarker discovery




MRC-IEU University of Bristol, United Kingdom
Apr 2019 - Jan 2020
University of Bristol one of the world’s top universities and is the de facto home of Mendelian Randomization.
Responsibility:

Applying Cutting edge genomics and epidemiology techniques to identify therapeutic targets for Autoimmune diseases.
Publish and communicate scientific research
Facilitate Academy-Pharma industry collaboration




KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Program
Mar 2018 - Jun 2019, Kilifi Kenya
KEMRI-Wellcome Trust is a one of a kind International research facility in Kenya and Africa leading in infectious disease research and clinical trials
Responsibility:

Support Institutional stastistical needs
Lead the statistics unit
Development of statistical methods for diverse omics datasets




KEMRI-Wellcome Trust Research Program
Mar 2016 - Nov 2018
Responsibility:

Conducting research on Malaria and virus genomics and diversity in long-term surveillance
Writing and publishing scientific work
Supervising Masters students and Interns




Heidelberg University
Jan 2019 - Mar 2019, Heidelberg, Germany
Responsibility:

Developing statistical methods for analysis of the KILchip Protein Microarray data




Pwani University
Jul 2016 - Present, Kilifi, Kenya
Responsibility:

Taught MSc Bioinformatics SBCG810 Biostatics and data science for Biology
Taught SBCG812, Databases and Data visualization
Examine Masters and Doctoral Thesis for the MSc bioinformatics and PhD Bioinformatics Program




Yukiguni Maitake
Mar 2015 - Sep 2015, Niigata, Japan
Responsibility: - Developing transcriptomics and genomics software tools to support research and development in Maitake Mushroom cultivation



Pharmaken Kenya LTD
Responsibility:
Marketing Anti-inflammatory and analgesic generic products in the Nairobi and North Eastern region

title: Nelson Kibinge
text:
Education

Ph.D – Computational Biology (2013-2015)
Nara Institute of Science and Technology (NAIST)
Thesis:
Integrated pathway-based transcription regulation network mining to decipher the role of transcription factors in the heterogeneity of small cell lung cancer phenotypes


M.Sc – Computational Biology (2011-2013)
Nara Institute of Science and Technology (NAIST)
Thesis:
Protein sequence diversity characterization using the physical attributes of amino acids: Examples in plasmodium falciparum sequences and in terpenoid enzymes


Intensive Japanese Language Course (2010-2011)
Osaka University


BSc in Biology (2004-2008)
University of Nairobi


St Patrick’s High School-Iten
1999-2002

title: Nelson Kibinge
text:
Orion Innovation Award (2025)

For the development of an in-house Oncology single cell explorer platform which is deployed in production for target discovery and ideation

Monbukagakusho (MEXT) scholarship Award (2010)

To Pursue Master and Doctor of Philosophy Studies in Bioinformatics

Gandhi Smarak Nidhi Fund Prize (2008)

Top Graduatte Student School of Biological Sciences, University of Nairobi Class of 2008
